channel.title: Cuda on The ML Surgeon
channel.description: Recent content in Cuda on The ML Surgeon

item.title: Profiling
item.description: Being a Machine Learning Surgeon is not an easy life. We not only have to deal with intricate machine learning systems but also navigate the additional complexities surrounding them. To be a proficient ML Surgeon, we must develop a diverse skill set.

item.title: A Machine Learning Surgeon’s Toolkit: Advanced Matrix Multiplication in CUDA
item.description: During the first year of my Master’s Degree in Computer Science, I had to complete a project for a Machine Learning course. It involved implementing a small feed-forward neural network framework from scratch, using only numerical libraries and coding elements such as loss functions, backpropagation, and the feed-forward step.

item.title: Hello CUDA: A Surgical Dissection
item.description: In case you didn’t already know, CUDA is a parallel computing platform and API, developed by NVIDIA, that enables programmers to exploit certain types of GPUs. Not too long ago (around until 2007), GPUs were solely utilized for graphics rendering, and programmers had to depend on very specific graphics APIs to utilize them for solving general problems.
